recipe.ingredients: 8 large eggs, 1/2 cup milk (preferably almond or skim), 2 cups baby spinach, 1 cup sliced mushrooms, 1 medium onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon olive oil
recipe.directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and oregano. Set aside, Heat olive oil in a 10-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add onions and mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, or until vegetables are soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1-2 minutes, Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. Cook for a couple of minutes just until the edges start to set, Sprinkle the top with grated Parmesan cheese, Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 8-10 minutes or until the center is set and the top is slightly golden brown, Remove from oven and let the frittata sit for a couple of minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.
recipe.nutrition: Calories 160, Total fat 11g, Protein 12g, Cholesterol 190mg, Total carbohydrate 4g, Dietary fiber 1g, Monounsaturated fat 5g, Saturated fat 3g, Added sugars 0g, Sodium 350mg, Trans fat 0g, Potassium 250mg, Total sugars 2g
